org.silex.core.block.Block

type
class
A publication in Silex is constituted of blocks. The blocks represent the publication structure, each block can have children and his aware of it's parent. All publications contain at least one block which is called the root block, all the other block being children to variying degree of this root block. A block is linked to the native DOM (might be Flash DOM, HTML DOM...) through it's DOMObject (an abstraction of a native DOMObject, might be a MovieClip/Sprite or a Div for instance). The DOMObject is the skin of the Block. A block can have no DOMObject in which case it is non-visual. A block has a nativeClassInstance. This is the controller class of the block. It is an abstraction wrapping a class instantiated in a specific runtime (ActionScript, JavaScript...). This class is loaded at runtime either in a library, loaded at publication startup, or it can be contained in a loaded DOMObject (skin). A block can have a DOMObject and no nativeClassInstance (the controller class is then assumed to be in the DOMObject), it can have only a nativeClassInstance or it can have both but it can't have neither. A block's 'model' is represented by it's properties and metadata, stored in the BlockData structure. They are loaded at runtime from an external file representing the block (might be XML, JSON...). The loaded properties are pushed into the nativeClassInstance or into the DOMObject (skin) when the block is initialised. A block is initialised with an instance of BlockBuilder, in charge of loading/instantiating it's data file, DOMObject (skin) and native class. A block is initialised when it is opened in most case, it will be displayed (attach to the native display list) once loaded. It may also be preloaded, for instance a block whose data file is shared with it's parent won't need to load an external text file. When a block opens, it also opens all of it's children whose "isAutoOpen" attribute is true. If a block is transversal (if it's isTransversal attribute is true), if a block deeper in the hierarchy than this block is opened, this block opens or remains open even if the opened block is not one of it's direct children or in it's children "lineage" (it's children of children of children...).

Constructor

new(fileUrl : String)
class constructor. Set the fileUrl attribute, which is the URL of the file containing the block's data. Init the children array

Instance Methods

addChild(block : Block) : Void

parameters
block the block to add as a children
Add the block in this block children array and set this block as the parent of the added block

addToDisplayList(blockDOMObject : org.silex.runtime.domobject.DOMObject) : Void

parameters
blockDOMObject the domObject to add
Add the block's DOMObject to this block DOMObjects. If this block has no DOMObject, add it to it's parent DOMObject

close() : Void

The block removes himself from the display list of it's parent, destroy the native class instance, then close all of it's children

getBlockData() : BlockData

getDOMObject() : org.silex.runtime.domobject.DOMObject

getFileUrl() : String

getIsAutoOpen() : Bool

getNativeClassInstance() : org.silex.runtime.nativeClass.NativeInstance

getParent() : Block

open(successCallback : Void -> Void, errorCallback : String -> Void) : Void

parameters
successCallback
errorCallback
Starts a block opening. To be opened a block must first be initialised (all of it's data must have loaded already). Stores the success and error callback.

removeChild(block : Block) : Void

parameters
block the block to remove from the children
Remove the block from the children array and from the display list. Reset it's parent

removeFromDisplayList(blockDOMObject : org.silex.runtime.domobject.DOMObject) : Void

parameters
blockDOMObject the domObject to remove
Remove the block's DOMObject from this block DOMObjects. If this block has no DOMObject, remove it from it's parent DOMObject

setBlockData(value : BlockData) : Void

setDOMObject(value : org.silex.runtime.domobject.DOMObject) : Void

setIsAutoOpen(value : Bool) : Void

setNativeClassInstance(nativeClassInstance : org.silex.runtime.nativeClass.NativeInstance) : Void

setParent(value : Block) : Void
